member.summary: UTC offset if it was found within the string.

member.name: P:Stimulsoft.Base.Helpers.DateTimeRoutines.DefaultDate
P:Stimulsoft.Base.Helpers.DateTimeRoutines.DefaultDateIsNow
member.summary: If true then DefaultDate property is ignored and DefaultDate is always DateTime.Now

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Base.Helpers.DateTimeRoutines.TryParseDateTime(System.String,Stimulsoft.Base.Helpers.DateTimeRoutines.DateTimeFormat,System.DateTime@)
member.summary: Tries to find date and time within the passed string and return it as DateTime structure.
member.param: string that contains date and/or time
format to be used preferably in ambivalent instances
member.returns: true if both date and time were found, else false

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Base.Helpers.DateTimeRoutines.TryParseDateOrTime(System.String,Stimulsoft.Base.Helpers.DateTimeRoutines.DateTimeFormat,System.DateTime@)
member.summary: Tries to find date and/or time within the passed string and return it as DateTime structure. If only date was found, time in the returned DateTime is always 0:0:0. If only time was found, date in the returned DateTime is DefaultDate.
member.param: string that contains date and(or) time
format to be used preferably in ambivalent instances
member.returns: true if date and/or time was found, else false

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Base.Helpers.DateTimeRoutines.TryParseTime(System.String,Stimulsoft.Base.Helpers.DateTimeRoutines.DateTimeFormat,System.DateTime@)
member.summary: Tries to find time within the passed string and return it as DateTime structure. It recognizes only time while ignoring date, so date in the returned DateTime is always 1/1/1.
member.param: format to be used preferably in ambivalent instances
member.returns: true if time was found, else false

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Base.Helpers.DateTimeRoutines.TryParseDate(System.String,Stimulsoft.Base.Helpers.DateTimeRoutines.DateTimeFormat,System.DateTime@)
member.summary: Tries to find date within the passed string and return it as DateTime structure. It recognizes only date while ignoring time, so time in the returned DateTime is always 0:0:0. If year of the date was not found then it accepts the current year.
member.param: format to be used preferably in ambivalent instances
member.returns: true if date was found, else false

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Base.Helpers.DateTimeRoutines.TryParseDateTime(System.String,Stimulsoft.Base.Helpers.DateTimeRoutines.DateTimeFormat,Stimulsoft.Base.Helpers.DateTimeRoutines.ParsedDateTime@)
member.summary: Tries to find date and time within the passed string and return it as ParsedDateTime object.
member.param: format to be used preferably in ambivalent instances
member.returns: true if both date and time were found, else false

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Base.Helpers.DateTimeRoutines.TryParseTime(System.String,Stimulsoft.Base.Helpers.DateTimeRoutines.DateTimeFormat,Stimulsoft.Base.Helpers.DateTimeRoutines.ParsedDateTime@)
member.summary: Tries to find time within the passed string and return it as ParsedDateTime object. It recognizes only time while ignoring date, so date in the returned ParsedDateTime is always 1/1/1
member.param: format to be used preferably in ambivalent instances
member.returns: true if time was found, else false

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Base.Helpers.DateTimeRoutines.TryParseDateOrTime(System.String,Stimulsoft.Base.Helpers.DateTimeRoutines.DateTimeFormat,Stimulsoft.Base.Helpers.DateTimeRoutines.ParsedDateTime@)
member.summary: Tries to find date and/or time within the passed string and return it as ParsedDateTime object. If only date was found, time in the returned ParsedDateTime is always 0:0:0. If only time was found, date in the returned ParsedDateTime is DefaultDate.
member.param: format to be used preferably in ambivalent instances
member.returns: true if date or time was found, else false

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Base.Helpers.DateTimeRoutines.TryParseTime(System.String,Stimulsoft.Base.Helpers.DateTimeRoutines.DateTimeFormat,Stimulsoft.Base.Helpers.DateTimeRoutines.ParsedDateTime@,Stimulsoft.Base.Helpers.DateTimeRoutines.ParsedDateTime)
member.summary: Tries to find time within the passed string (relatively to the passed parsedDate if any) and return it as ParsedDateTime object. It recognizes only time while ignoring date, so date in the returned ParsedDateTime is always 1/1/1
member.param: format to be used preferably in ambivalent instances
ParsedDateTime object if the date was found within this string, else NULL
member.returns: true if time was found, else false

member.name: M:Stimulsoft.Base.Helpers.DateTimeRoutines.TryParseDate(System.String,Stimulsoft.Base.Helpers.DateTimeRoutines.DateTimeFormat,Stimulsoft.Base.Helpers.DateTimeRoutines.ParsedDateTime@)
member.summary: Tries to find date within the passed string and return it as ParsedDateTime object. It recognizes only date while ignoring time, so time in the returned ParsedDateTime is always 0:0:0. If year of the date was not found then it accepts the current year.
member.param: format to be used preferably in ambivalent instances
member.returns: true if date was found, else false
